Sentencas: A series of ceramic-metal composite anodes containing 1.0 wt.% Cu1-xPdx alloys (where x=0, 0.15, 0.25, 0.4,0.5,0.75 and 1.0) were prepared by impregnation of the respective metal salts and 5.0 wt.% CeO2 into a porous La0.4Ce0.6O2-sigma anode skeleton.
Titulo: Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The performance of these anodes was evaluated in both dry H-2 and CH4 in the temperature range of 700-800 degrees C using the 300-mu m thick La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.83Mg0.17O3-sigma (LSGM) electrolyte-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The addition of Pd to Cu significantly increased the performance of the single cells in dry CH4, with the cell maximum power density changed from 66 mW cm(-2) for Cu1.0Pd0.0 to 345 mW cm(-2) for Cu0.0Pd1.0 at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In H-2, however, the performance improvement was not as significant compared to that in CH4.
Titulo: Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, carbon formation was greatly suppressed in the Cu-Pd alloy-impregnated anodes compared to that with pure Pd after exposure to dry CH4 at 800 degrees C, which led to different performance stability behaviors for these cells operating with dry CH4.
Titulo: Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells
Cu1-xPdx/CeO2-impregnated cermet anodes for direct oxidation of methane in LaGaO3-electrolyte solid oxide fuel cells
